course_title: Advanced Topics in Film and Media Studies: Artificial Intelligence & Film
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 11Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course examines cinematic depictions of artificial intelligence as well as recent developments in the use of A.I. in film production and within the film industry. Students will create short A.I.-generated films as part of the course. 
The required screenings for this class will take place as part of the Emory Cinematheque.
course_description: This course is designed to give advanced students the opportunity to investigate intensively a specialized topic in film and media studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 301 or FILM 301W or FILM 302 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location:
TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in White Hall 200
W 7:30pm-10pm in White Hall 208
